greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest exponent such that prime(n)^k is pandigital in base 10.
comment: A pandigital number is an integer that in a given base has among its significant digits each digit used in the base at least once.
reference: E.I. Ignatjew, Mathematische Spielereien, Urania Verlag Leipzig-Jena-Berlin, 2. Auflage 1982.
Helmut Kracke, Mathe-musische Knobelisken, Duemmler Bonn, 2. Auflage 1983.
link: David A. Corneth, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(k=1, p=prime(n)); while(#Set(digits(p^k))<10, k++); k; } \\ _Jinyuan Wang_, Aug 14 2020
results.author: Eva-Maria Zschorn (e-m.zschorn(AT)zaschendorf.km3.de), Dec 17 2009
ext: Edited by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 02 2010
